meanings.definition: Existing or occurring together in the same time or place.
meanings.sent1: The sun and the moon are coexistent in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The plants and animals in the forest are coexistent.
meanings.sent3: It's like having two friends who are always coexistent at every party.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was so strong, it felt like they were coexistent souls.
meanings.sent5: The colors of the rainbow are coexistent and beautiful.

meanings.definition: Able to exist or occur together without conflict.
meanings.sent1: The peaceful coexistent relationship between the neighbors was admirable.
meanings.sent2: The different species of fish in the aquarium were coexistent without any issues.
meanings.sent3: The coexistent puzzle pieces fit perfectly together.
meanings.sent4: Their ideas were coexistent, creating a harmonious work environment.
meanings.sent5: The coexistent melodies blended seamlessly in the music composition.
